snippet: The former chief justice of the Constitutional Court was sentenced to life in prison for corruption, the heaviest sentence ever for graft in one of the most corrupt countries in the world.
abstract: Akil Mochtar, former chief justice of Indonesia's Constitutional Court, is sentenced to life in prison for corruption, heaviest sentence ever for graft in what is considered one of most corrupt countries in world.
lead_paragraph: The former chief justice of the Constitutional Court was sentenced to life in prison for corruption, the heaviest sentence ever for graft in one of the most corrupt countries in the world.
